text: TAT-3 was the third transatlantic telephone cable, in operation from 1963 to 1986. It had 414 kHz of bandwidth, allowing it to carry 138 telephone circuits (simultaneous calls). It was long, connecting Widemouth Bay in Cornwall, England to Tuckerton, New Jersey in the United States. It was owned by AT&T; and GPO (now BT).http://www.atlantic- cable.com/Cables/CableTimeLine/index1951.htm ==References== Category:AT&T; buildings Category:British Telecom buildings and structures Category:Infrastructure completed in 1963 Category:Science and technology in Cornwall Category:Transatlantic communications cables Category:United Kingdom–United States relations
title: TAT-3
